critique: The executive order aims to evoke a sense of hope and determination to improve the child welfare system. It highlights the challenges faced by children in foster care and emphasizes the need for stability and permanent families. The order also seeks to address the factors contributing to the extended stays of children in foster care and aims to promote partnerships between state agencies and community organizations. The president wants to convey a sense of urgency and commitment to addressing these issues and improving the lives of vulnerable children.
